desc: This is my description. You call this cat food? leave dead animals as gifts love to play with owner's hair tie cat is love, cat is life for mark territory scamper. Nap all day i am the best so touch water with paw then recoil in horror so sweet beast, or lay on arms while you're using the keyboard purr for no reason. Run in circles. Rub face on everything leave fur on owners clothes. Brown cats with pink ears vommit food and eat it again. Claws in your leg hack up furballs or chase ball of string and peer out window, chatter at birds, lure them to mouth lick yarn hanging out of own butt yet intently stare at the same spot, and eat from dog's food. Stare at ceiling light when in doubt, wash so stick butt in face, but brown cats with pink ears yet jump off balcony, onto stranger's head but hide at bottom of staircase to trip human.
headline: This is my headline
question1: As property values have increased for the past few years, is it time to reduce city property tax rates?
question2: Palm Beach County may ask voters this year to approve a local sales tax increase. Some of the revenue would go to municipalities. Do you support a sales tax increase?

questionlist.question: Does the historic Boynton Beach High School deserve to be saved?

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: The non ad-valorem tax for the fire assessment needs to be reevaluated. In addition, Boynton Beach's ad-valorem tax base is $4.6 billion (Boca Mag 05/26/2015), which is surprisingly low and needs to be addressed. I will be requesting the Palm Beach Property Appraiser to reevaluate property values and believe tax rates can be reduced because the property values will increase. Furthermore, I would  start transferring property in the CRA as soon as possible to create further revenues for the city.
responses.Does_the_city_have_an_employee_pension_p: I believe Boynton's employees should have a pension. The issue arises on the funding of that pension. Working with the unions I would propose of ways to reduce pension costs and employer contributions. My recommendation would be to move future Police and all of Fire to the Florida Retirement System to help reduce the city's pension obligation.
responses.Does_the_historic_Boynton_Beach_High_Sch: Currently, Boynton Beach is being asked for $1.5 million for construction costs and a $300,000 20 year lease with a 3% annual increase from the developer who stated he would put $4.5 million for a total $6 million dollar repair. I would research potential grants for the repair of a historic building, Revenue and GO municipal bonds, and seek corporate sponsorship; and to explore all options of funding available.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: Bachelor of Science in Finance: University of Maryland, Smith School of Business | Juris Doctor: Florida Coastal School of Law | Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology in Melbourne, Australia 2003 | China University of Political Science and Law in Beijing, China 2008 | University of Netherlands Antilles in Willemstad, Curacao in 2010
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Financial Advisory Committee of Boynton Beach from 2012-2014, chairman for 2013-2014.
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Owner and attorney at TheFloridaLawOffice.com from 2011-2016.
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Boynton is a residential community and I believe increasing the sales tax will hurt the residents and business owners. Furthermore, if Boynton has a lower sales tax then neighboring municipalities, I would hope more people would come to Boynton for the lower tax; thereby increasing demand for Boynton.
responses.Should_Boynton_Beach_create_a_downtown_E: With the construction of 500 Ocean and repairing of the old high school Boynton will have anchors on Ocean Avenue for nighttime activities. In addition, MLK Blvd needs to be developed as another street for nighttime activities. The problem arises from private property and my solution is to build on what Boynton currently has rather than waiting for another 5+ years.

responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Small built out / one new development approved
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: BBA business University of Miami
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: No Roads or Schools, service response time good
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: PBC League of Cities Board  PBC Impact Fee Committee
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: South Palm Beach Councilor (2005-2015
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: half cent tax yes /  beach's hard structures should be considered as infrastructure

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Palm Beach Gardens is a very fiscally sound city and we need to keep it this way. Council needs to keep looking a property values and in the event we can reduce taxes we should. We do have older areas of the city (Plat 1-6) that are in need of beautification projects to make sure the quality of life in these areas increase as well as the property values. These areas have not been addressed for years by the council that I am aware of.
responses.Do_you_support_Avenir_development_Explan: Avenir is going to be a beautiful project for the wester community. I do have many concerns on its impact the ecosystem and with traffic as it will bring thousands of vehicles to our roadways. Avenir will only be able to to "capture" some of the traffic in that area. Without a project like Avenir that parcel of land would be sold out as lots and it would be a continuation of the Acreage. That is not the vision for Palm Beach Gardens.
responses.Does_City_Hall_have_a_communication_prob: I believe it does. I have been in a council meeting for 4 1/2 hours on a development project. At 1040 p.m. the mayor read a statement in support of this project and a agreement with the developer. It seemed to me and much of the audience (packed house) that the mayor was speaking for all of the council members. In conclusion it was a unanimous vote! While campaigning I have had many residents tell similar issues with back door deals and so on.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: I have extensive education in Traffic Homicide and Reconstruction. All of my certifications and continued education is through IPTM. The list is too many to name but can be available if requested.
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: This is my first time running for office.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: As a police officer I was very involved with Community Oriented Policing projects. Although this is not a city committee it is "Police" program that is very ingrained with the community. There is a high level of problem solving  when it comes to issues pertaining to crime, traffic issues and so on. During this time I reconstructed 2 intersections to reduce the amount of crashes, serious bodily injury crashes and vehicle homicides.
responses.List_positions_and_years_you_unsuccessfu: This is my first attempt at being elected to office.
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: My company is CW Services & Associates, Inc. We have been incorporated since 1995. We conduct private investigations, crash investigations and service of process. We have many jobs going on around the state of Florida and the country. Previous to running for PBG City Council I was a reserve officer with the Town of Jupiter, Previous to that I was a reserve office with PBG Police department. Previous to that I was full time with PBG Police assigned to Traffic division.
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Palm Beach Gardens is financially secure at this point and the city does not need the additional revenue from a countywide sales tax increase. This tax is designed for infrastructure projects that the county desperately needs to work on. Palm Beach Gardens does not. There are ways we can self fund projects for infrastructure needs. We do not need this additional money from the county.
responses.The_city_has_limited_amounts_of_developa: Palm Beach Gardens is now built out with the approval of Avenir. We need to make sure our conservation efforts and the protection of our preserve areas and ecosystem is not endangered as the city grows with roads, flyovers and so on. We do not want to be Broward County.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Not yet, but we are on our way.  We have had such inequities in regards to our taxable valuations that we are finally starting to catch up.  It is essential right now that we invest in our infrastructure and maintenance.  As investment comes to our city, my hope is to bring the taxes down.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: BFA Emerson College Boston,MA Theater and Communications Connecticut School of Broadcasting
responses.If_so_in_what_ways_would_you_address_the: Homelessness and its causes are a national issue that we struggle to deal with as a small city.  The first thing I created was an ordinance that gives PBSO the ability to offer a list of services available as well as free transportation to The Lewis Center. In addition we have welcomed a new Goodwill, The Lords Place Shelter, have held a Project Homeless Connect with the Homeless Coalition and will be holding a summit soon with advocates to discuss other options including mobile hygiene units.
responses.If_so_what_ways_can_the_issue_be_address: Potholes are just the symptom of a bigger problem, which is infrastructure neglect.  I have helped create the city's first ever comprehensive roadway master plan that not only addresses potholes, but they reason they exist to begin with, along with water, sewer, drainage, sidewalks and curbing. In our upcoming budget cycle, we will need to address viable funding sources, (like earlier answers) In the meantime our new pothole patching equipment is getting a good workout!
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: Mayor, City of Lake Worth November 2011 - Present
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Chair - City of Lake Worth Employee Pension Board, Member - LW Police Pension Board, Voting Member - Metropolitan Planning Organization (MPO), Chair - Mayor's Education Council, City Commission Liaison to the Neighborhood Association President's Council
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: President/Owner - First Impressions Creative Services, Inc.  1997-Present
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: A 60-40 split on the half cent or a 30-20 split on the full cent could go a long way with our backlog of road projects without relying on property taxes (as in your previous question). Tourists and visitors pay a good portion of this tax as they use the roads too.  This is one issue that would need serious discussion as it influences our budget discussions and can change funding sources .
responses.What_should_the_city_do: The Lake Worth Casino and Pool needs to be filled and functional. We must come up with solutions we all can support through community discussions.  First we need to resolve design and construction issues that prevent the space from being leased.  As for the hotel, it is not city owned and a private project.   We hope it will be a great hotel that will finally bring tourism to our city.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Along with the city bond that's proposed and providing the 1 cent sales tax is passed, we should have a good source of funds to address the needs of our city's infrastructure and parks.
responses.Can_the_problem_of_homelessness_and_panh: It's an ongoing problem that we are working on by partnering with Habitat, The Lord's Place, the Homeless Coalition, our Vickers House, and the Lewis Center.  We have donated one building to the Lord's Place and are inventorying all to see how else we can help.  HCD has recently put forth a program that helps by providing the payments needed to secure a rental place to live.
responses.Do_you_feel_like_its_possible_to_shape_a: Most of the time! Through ordinances, building and zoning codes.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: B.F.A. Art Education: Maryland Institute, College of Art
responses.Is_poverty_a_problem_in_and_around_your_: By improving our schools, helping the homeless find housing, working with Habitat for Humanity, other non-profits and our City's Housing and Community Development and its Vickers House.
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: City of West Palm Beach Commissioner, 2010-2016
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Tourist Development Council,Cultural Council, Children's Services Council's Children's Cabinet, Reentry Task Force, Superintendent's Task Force
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Commissioner for the City of West Palm Beach, 2011-2016,
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: It's a proposed 10 year tax and will benefit much needed infrastructure repair to buildings and roads.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: During the recession the City had to be more efficient in providing services.  The increase in property values now provides more revenue than the City needs.  We reduced our tax year this year.
responses.Do_you_support_Avenir_development_Explan: Working hard with the developer lowered the number of homes from 7600  to 3000.  The developer has committed to building commercial and office space to capture trips form the Acreage. 2400 acres will be restored to natural wetlands that will help with water supply and flooding.
responses.Does_City_Hall_have_a_communication_prob: The budget and agenda packages are on-line. We video stream council meetings live and the video is also available after the meeting.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: B.S. Geology-Florida State University, M.S. Geological Sciences-Virginia Tech
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: LRMCC, LOC, WRTF, LOC Environmental Committee, BLAB
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Risk Management Services, Inc. Principal 1995-Present
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: The City of Palm Beach Gardens does not need the revenue generated by the tax.  The City has budgeted for our infrastructure needs and does not need the revenue.
responses.The_city_has_limited_amounts_of_developa: The City is approaching build out and needs to adjust to that fact.  However, the City exceeds it infrastructure needs and impact fees have been spent wisely.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: As property values increase, so do municipal costs. Infrastructure repairs need to be carried out.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Growth should be encouraged, but cautiously. Lantana's biggest asset is our small-town atmosphere. We have kept a five-story limit on two new major developments and turned down five of five variance requests.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: BA, Miss. State - English/Sociology; Grad work, NYU - TV Production
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: Two huge developments will be underway in a few months; sports fields are under construction; Lantana Middle is an "A" school; we've fixed drainage at Sea Pines and the beach.
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: Lantana Town Council, 2013-2016; Editor, MSU student paper, 1963-1964
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Chairman Lantana Nature Preserve; Student Advisory Council; Lantana Library; Fl League of Cities
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Freelance TV producer/writer, 1979-present
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: We should get additional revenue from increasing property values. Our recovery is at a snail's pace.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: Lantana faces rising crime, especially around cheap motels on Hypoluxo Rd. We've got a great police department; keeping Lantana a safe place to live is critical. Parking around the business district is a huge challenge; we are in the process of adding 30 spaces on North Lake Drive. Our beach, our biggest natural asset, has disappeared. I'm going to keep fighting to bring it back.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Lantana's property tax rates have not changed over the last 15 years and the town's consistent tax rate, despite the changes in property values over those years, is admirable.  However, the town must make sure that it uses the added revenues from both the increased property values and the Water Tower Commons and Cenacle projects wisely.  We must look to the future and use the revenues to add value to our town.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: We cannot stop growth and we cannot stop the future.  I believe that as we grow as a town, we must have a vision developed by our community to guide our decisions.  We must recognize that every decision we make may impact the future and it is our responsibility to make thoughtful decisions.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: University of Florida, B.A. Political Science/Criminology; University of Virginia School of Law, J.D.
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: There is much room for improvement in our town's role in servicing our community.  Our town needs to advocate for our community in resolving traffic issues on Lantana Road and Ocean Ave.  We need safer pedestrian crossings and additional parking in our downtown area.  We must encourage our police department to continue with their community policing efforts.  We must support our schools and provide positive opportunities for our youth.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: None
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Managing Attorney, Arsali LLC, 2014-Present; Law Clerk to the Honorable John E. Steele, United States District Court for the Middle District of Florida, 2012-2014; Associate, Boies, Schiller and Flexner LLP, 2009-2011
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Our town does not need additional sources of tax revenue.  Instead, we as a community must come up with a plan for our future and work towards that goal. With a plan, we can decide as a community where to invest the taxes we pay to allow our town to develop into its full potential.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: Lantana is a town of great history and potential.  That potential, however, has not been fully realized because we lack a shared vision.  Our infrastructure needs investment.  Our downtown is both underutilized and riddled with traffic issues because of its lack of parking.  We need to connect the new development with the old.  We need to invest in our youth and in our community, so, that all feel welcome and are proud to make Lantana their home.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: As values  continue to rise  and with better management of funds  we will be able to reduce millage rate.
responses.Does_the_city_have_an_employee_pension_p: Pension Reform must be done to avoid crisis in ten years.  To do we need to negotiate  with unions and have those with 5 years or more of service keep their plan - those with less than 5 years be put on a 401K  with city match to 4%.
responses.Does_the_historic_Boynton_Beach_High_Sch: Implementing the REG/Straticon  plan  after financial vetting.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: B.A. - History and Business... College- Fairleigh Dickinson University
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: Boynton Beach City Commissioner District 1 2013 - Current  City Council  Ft. Lee, NJ 1970's
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: CRA Board  2013 - current  League of Cities - Palm Beach County - 2013 -current
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Owner-Merker Insurance Group, Florida-David T. Merker- Insurance Agent- 1996-Current
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: At this time  we are still recovering from recession and do not need to add  further burden to citizens.  With proper budget management we can reduce tax.
responses.Should_Boynton_Beach_create_a_downtown_E: With 500 Ocean and other projects coming online we are slowly developing a downtown.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: The time is coming soon to reduce the millage rate.  We had to raise the millage during the recession to pay for the necessities.  Now, Boynton Beach is among the the highest property tax rates in Palm Beach county.  There are significant economic development activities that can take place that will draw more people to want to work, live, and play in Boynton Beach,  This will cause property values to increase and tax revenues will still increase, even with a lower millage.
responses.Does_the_city_have_an_employee_pension_p: Yes, if everyone retired today Boynton Beach would have an employee pension problem.  Luckily people are on different retirement schedules and that gives time to make adjustments. It will take careful budgeting over numerous budget cycles to make sure what we promise our employees is indeed what we can deliver.
responses.Does_the_historic_Boynton_Beach_High_Sch: The historic Boynton Beach High School should be saved and used as an economic anchor for the downtown.  By doing a real development deal on the High School, it can be saved.  The existing layout of the building is ideal for retail businesses, offices, studios and a theater.  The High School can become a destination for visitors plus there are enough residents within walking distance to make the project economically viable and the building would make enough revenue to maintain itself.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: B.A. in Political Science from Florida Atlantic University
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Boynton Beach Planning and Development Board. Boynton Beach Code Compliance Board. Boynton Beach Sister Cities Board. Boynton Beach Charter Review Committee. Boynton Beach Floodwater Mitigation Task Force. Boynton Beach Brand Promise Committee. Greater Boynton Beach Chamber of Commerce Government Affairs Committee
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Realtor, 2005-2016 & Retail Manager at The Men's Wearhouse, 2013-2016
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: I could support a 0.5 - 1.0 cent sales tax increase if the money is used for infrastructure.  Then the property owner is not further taxed and the cost to improve infrastructure is distributed more evenly among everyone.
responses.Should_Boynton_Beach_create_a_downtown_E: People want to be able to walk to their amenities. An active downtown creates stability in surrounding neighborhoods. The Marina is the focal point of the Boynton Beach downtown. It extends to the surrounding neighborhoods on Federal Hwy and to the historic High School.Starting a downtown takes making the High School a destination, rebuilding Ocean Ave retail frontages, redeveloping Boynton Beach Blvd and improving the Federal Hwy corridor.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: No. City property taxes should not be lowered because a great deal of the funding that the schools receive comes from these taxes and I would not want to be in a position to bring on an increasing burden on the educational system in Palm Beach County.
responses.Can_the_problem_of_homelessness_and_panh: There is no set pattern to overtake or channel the issue of homelessness and panhandling in the city.  I would seek assistance in developing an awareness mechanism to inform the homeless and panhandles of available channel to remedy their lack of shelter, food and medical needs and/or any other assistance needed.
responses.Do_you_feel_like_its_possible_to_shape_a: Economic growth and development must take place. A Sustainable city is a city that embraces socioeconomics, technological, and global changes and accepts the fact that natural and human resources are finite. Implement programs that will enhance knowledge and training for economic growth within itself through volunteer services made available in the communities.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: GED Murray High
responses.Is_poverty_a_problem_in_and_around_your_: Create affordable housing for low/moderate and middle income families and residents Foster the racial, socio-economic, cultural and religious diversity of our district. Promote and support Human Services, Public Education, and Out of School Learning for all ages. Create jobs.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Palm Beach County Community Action Advisory Board
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Palm Beach County Health Department  Personnel Technician II 1976-1999
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Until there is a minimum wage increase, there should not be a sales tax increase.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: The current tax rate is similar or lower than other communities in Palm Beach county.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: PhD Computer Science Univ Okla
responses.How_would_you_resolve_the_conflict: There should be a reasonable solution to this problem and guidelines agreed with by Harbourside and the council. The band shell was approved by the council and should not have to get a permit every time it is used. Noise levels and times should be reason but Harbourside needs some entertainment to attract customers.
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: President and Treasure of several HOAs
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: none
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Retired help Medicare AEP
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: The economy is not strong enough and people do not want more taxes.
responses.What_ideas_do_you_have_for_the_future_of: The main roads should be made more attractive and better able to handle the increased traffic load.
responses.Why_or_why_not: There is over development of commercial property and creating too much traffic for our town.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Because the excess funds can be used for infrastructure.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: I support prudent growth in our town.  Our current council voted against five of five variances for the waterfront development before approving it.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: Mississippi State-BA English
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: I will continue to support our service personnel especially in our schools. I will support the needs our our police department and see that our roads are repaired "as needed".
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Lantana Library and Student Advisory Council, Lantana Middle School
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Lantana Town Council Member 2013-2016
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Palm Beach County receives a bed tax, especially during season, so we do not need to burden our residents with an additional sales tax.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: The beach is our biggest asset and it has almost vanished. I will work with state and local departments to do all that is necessary to bring our beaches back.  Parking is also an issue and the council is adding additional lots on North Lake and 3rd Street and we will continue to listen to our residents.  Traffic has increased and our council has several traffic studies underway.

responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: asfd
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: asdf

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Yes South Palm Beach pays one of the highest mill rates in the county for the fewest services.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: We are built our as a city and have only one new condo unit under construction
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: PhD in Chemical Eng.  UConn
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: We have a police chief and assistant chief for 5 officers.   This is not justified.  Our current chief  is retiring soon and we can promote the  assistant  to chief an eliminate one management role.   The  planning department requires contractors to pay a annual fee to work in the town.  This drives up the cost  of repairs and lowers the quality of the contractors as all we get are contractors who need work

responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: No, I do not as an IT professional who has had public sector clients in the past 20 years I have seen the wasteful spending first hand
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: The present town council does not do there home work when it come to issues. They make decision  based upon  and I quote 'like'  the council need to make  decision in the best interest of the residents.  For example they signed a 10 year contract with waste management that will increase WM profit by  3 to 4 times and can never go down nor renegotiated.   For my Condo the yearly rate will go from  10,000 to almost 16000 of that  6,000 is pure profit

responses.Any_social_or_website_addresses_youd_lik: Anne Gerwig for Mayor of Wellington (facebook)
responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: We have  lowered the rate in Wellington because property values increased enough to allow increased services at a lower rate.
responses.Do_you_support_the_FDOT_changes_to_South: At this point, the changes proposed do not negatively impact Wellington.
responses.Do_you_support_the_potential_purchase_of: Not at this point, at least. The price that it is being offered for, along with the needed improvements to the greens, makes it a questionable purchase  with taxpayer money.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: I attended North Tech Education Center while in high school. I also took classes at PB State in Land Surveying and was trained in computer aided drafting and design.

responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: As long as the voters support it, I would support it. The voters should decide if more cultural arts, and infrastructure improvements are needed. A sales tax shares the burden with all users, not only property owners.
responses.Should_the_council_have_a_role_in_making: The EPA is a vital element of our local economy. Preserving the open spaces and the industry is crucial to maintain property values and levels of municipal service.

responses.Any_social_or_website_addresses_youd_lik: "Vote for Wayne R. Posner" Face book page
responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Simply, as more taxes are collected due to an increase in property value there is no need for rates to stay the same. Historically the cost of living for goods and service does not rise at the same pace as real estate values. Therefor as a government we should be able to balance the budget without an increase in the rate and may well be able to decrease the rate.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: Attended Philadelphia Community College
responses.How_would_you_resolve_the_conflict: This issue should have never occurred. Most amphitheaters are three sided and project sound in one direction. This could easily be solved by installing sound resistant glass, sound panels and some speaker control. I personally built sound proof recording studios and sound proof rooms.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Planning and Zoning Commission for the Town of Jupiter
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Retired, owned a commercial general contracting company from 1971~2013.
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: We need to become more fiscally responsible and not look to hurt our businesses and consumers by raising taxes.
responses.What_ideas_do_you_have_for_the_future_of: Indiantown Road is currently quite crowded and we need to reevaluate our options with professional engineers as well as the county to see our options. There maybe special routes or transportation alternatives that can be explored.
responses.Why_or_why_not: Although some development is inevitable, we must ensure that projects are compatible with our town, make sense, and are of quality design. I will use my experience as a former builder to insure a more streamline process through clearer communications and code interpretation.  Developments must be sustainable at all levels and environmentally sound. We need to be able to do this in a seamless expedient way so as not to create delays and controversy. Right the first time!!!

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: It is always time to analyze cost saving opportunities that could translate into reduced property taxes. Jupiter already has one of the lowest tax rates in the County, which has lowered even further this past year. The Town has done an excellent job over the years of living within its means evidenced by coming out of the recession stronger than ever.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: MBA
responses.How_would_you_resolve_the_conflict: The noise issue with Harbourside is no different than other sound conflicts we've had with the Square Grouper and Guanabanas over the years.  This is part of the growing pains of a project like Harbourside and I'm confident we will find a balance between what residents and businesses expect in terms of quality of life and live entertainment at the amphitheater.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: LOC
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: President, Special District Services, Inc. 2005-2016
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: The Town has done an excellent job of planning for the future and paying for infrastructure improvements but there are still many projects that could be financed with a penny sales tax, including cultural opportunities and especially money for improved schools.
responses.What_ideas_do_you_have_for_the_future_of: I plan to initiate an organization that will focus on improving Indiantown Road, similar to the PGA Corridor Association, that will focus on improvements to the traffic movement and aesthetics along that corridor. Also the two main undeveloped parcels are just off of Indiantown Road and those will be heavily scrutinized projects in the next few years.
responses.Why_or_why_not: Managing growth is the cornerstone of my campaign.  We certainly have a lot of pressures from outsiders, including those from neighboring communities, and we must maintain our quality of life. But Jupiter is 95% built out so the development that is occurring is largely attributed to redevelopment. So the challenge is how do we make redevelopment work without destroying our quality of life.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: I think more control should be on what we are taking in
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: brighton high  brighton mich  12 grade
responses.If_so_in_what_ways_would_you_address_the: would like to sit down with the church leaders and business owners to brainstorm.i know it can be done
responses.If_so_what_ways_can_the_issue_be_address: I would like to see some maintenece done in the city to show it can be done before any money is asked for
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: cival service  chairman
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: 1982-2016  garyandlee lawn service  owner
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: it has not been said what or where the money will go
responses.What_should_the_city_do: these two should be separated the hotel is private and should stay that way.the casino is public and should stay that way

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: The pension plans unfunded liability shortfall payments are increasing the general fund budget by $10 million per year from $66 million to $76 million.  This amounts to approximately 3 mils and must be paid first.
responses.Does_the_city_have_an_employee_pension_p: A hybrid plan.  I believe a 92% defined benefit plan plus an 8% market sensitive benefit will yield an average of 98% of current benefits.  The small market sensitive benefit is big enought to  cause the pension boards to be more responsive to developing problems which means little problems will not grow over time to be City destroying problems.  Right now the pension boards have no "skin" in the game so to them the tens of million of dollars they invest is monopoly money.
responses.Does_the_historic_Boynton_Beach_High_Sch: I organized and lead the volunteer group Save Boynton High!  The architect Rick Gonzales's plan is viable.  Basically move the Civic Center and Arts Center programs into the back of the school and rent out the front to business.  The civic center will soon need major renovations.  The cost of that can be applied to saving the historic high school.  Moving activities into the high school makes it a smoother transitional process for the proposed Town Square P3 project.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: :  BA Political Science 1975 FAU;  BA Economics 1978 FAU; Paramedic 2000 PBCC; AS Fire Science 2006 PBCC;  BS Civil Engineering 2014 FAU
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: Boynton Beach City Commissioner 2013- to present
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: 2 years Code Enforcement; 5 years Recreation and Parks; 5 years Planning and Development
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Boynton Beach City Commissioner 2013-2016;  Boynton Beach Fire Lt./Paramedic 1991-2013; Building Contractor 1979-1991
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Sales taxes are regressive taxes and unfairly target the poor and middle class.  Some of PBC problems are due to setting development impact fees too low.  Also Manalapan and Jupiter are charged lower Fire assessments than the rest of the County.  Fix these inequities before taxing the middle class.
responses.Should_Boynton_Beach_create_a_downtown_E: It is well on its way with a viable marina, a 340 unit 7 story rental apartments, and many new small businesses.  Saving the historic high school helps give the area a sense of place and uniqueness.    The only real direct  The AAF double track provides a great benefit by allowing the creation of Tri-Rail Coastal Link.  A new commuter and passenger train linking all coastal cities.  This train station will create a downtown.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: No. Property values dropped so low, the cost of police and fire exceed the ad valorem revenues Lake Park receives each year.  Lake Park is almost at the millage cap.  Increased property values are needed.  Redevelopment will lead to increased values.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Most new growth will be redevelopment.  It needs to be compatible with surrounding properties, especially residential uses.  While we need investment in the community, developers need to be sensitive to the Town character.  Ordinances are being considered to provide flexibility to developers, but in exchange, new development must fit into our built environment.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: MPA from FAU, BA from Illinois State Univ
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: The Town has little revenue.  We have not been able to repave streets or repair sidewalks.  Redevelopment is needed to bring higher property values to the Town.  Underutilized parcels are keeping property values low; but incentives can attract investment and lead to increased values.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: Lake Park Planning & Zoning Board (2012-2013)
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Village of Palm Springs Land Development Director 2014-present
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: It would be a new revenue source that would come from tourists and seasonal residents who may not otherwise pay property tax to the Town.  The Town has millions of dollars in capital projects (street repaving, drainage improvements, etc) that are unfunded.  The sales tax could provide funding to meet Town infrastructure needs.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: 1) Lake Shore Drive infrastructure deficiencies (drainage, tidal protection, road condition); 2) Sanitary sewer for western industrial area still on septic tanks; 3) Park Avenue revitalization.  The Town needs to seek grants or special assessments as a funding source.  Deficiencies cannot continue to be ignored, they will only become more costly.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: I don't believe this is a time to reduce property tax because the city is in transition and is definitely in need of funds. It is a possibility that it can be considered at a later date, but I do not think that the city can afford to reduce it's taxes at this time. There has been talk of being debt free by May, but it remains to be seen and if that happens, then at that time consideration can be given to that reduction.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: My focused is on the economic development and what hinders that process from taking place within Pahokee. I want to investigate and report the findings that hinder the economic growth of our city. I would like to work with city officials to dispel that hindrance and welcome newcomers with jobs and opportunities for the people and the city. I want to see individuals within our city open and start their own businesses and start that economic chain to turning again.

responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: To date, there is not a police department in our city. The Palm Beach County Sheriff Department was incorporated to police our city. Our city is not self sufficient and that is one of my concerns. Our roads are in need of a severe makeovers. There are many concerns within the city including unity, which is a big concern for myself and other candidates. We know that the city suffers due to a split among the people.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: I have served on several committees throughout twenty years or more. Some of those committees were/are: Glades Community Development Committee (GCDC); Pahokee Law Enforcement Committee (PLEC); Glades Interagency Network (GIN); Bridges Committee and presently on the I Love Pahokee Committee.

responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Sales tax increases are often and I don't think that there is enough sufficient data to support a sales tax increase.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: Once again, I think the biggest problem we have to face in our city is united for the good of the whole. People have become very distrustful with good reason. I would like to restore their trust and work through transparency and integrity to up build and uplift our city to new destinations.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: We have the lowest mileage rate in Palm Beach County. We are a relatively new town with several ongoing projects.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Loxahatchee Groves is comprised mostly by 5 acre homesites.  There are many agricultural businesses on our town. Also we are adding horse facilities in increasing numbers.
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: I completed 2 years of college as a Math and secondary education major. I came to Florida to work a summer and worked in construction. I found myself making more than teachers and there were no teaching jobs. I completed a 3 year apprentice program as a bricklayer and worked 40 years in this trade.
responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: Many residents want their roads improved (many are dirt or gravel) but don not want to pay any additional taxes.
responses.List_elected_offices_you_have_held_and_d: Loxahatchee Groves Water Control District as a Supervisor from 1996 to 2007. Elected to Town of Loxahatchee Groves Town Council in 2007 and I've served as the Mayor from then to present.
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: None at present time.
responses.List_positions_and_years_you_unsuccessfu: Ran unsuccessfully for Loxahatchee Groves Water Control Board in 1995.
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: I am retired. I worked 35 years with Pompano Masonry Corp. until 2010, then taught an Adult Masonry Class for the Florida Masonry Assoc.until Jan. 2016.
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: This money can be used to finance projects in our town.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: I feel our biggest problem are people who want to buy in our town, change land use and zoning, then selling for a large profit. I have lived in Loxahatchee Groves since 1979 and would love to remain the rest of my life. I cherish those who have chosen our unique town to reside and want to stay.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: I believe our city property tax rates should remain the same or be reduced, if possible.  I am not in favor of a property tax increase.  A tax increase will decease disposable income for families, because it takes money out of the household.  The City has to find better ways of generating tax dollars without putting the majority of the burden of property owners. Our city currently have one of the highest millage rates in Palm Beach County.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Yes, through economic development, I support growth of our city.  Growth and economic development is my number one priority and concern for our city sustainable future.

responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: No, the City of Pahokee has struggled over the past few years to improve city infrastructure with a tight budget and limited human resources.  The City must begin to turn to technology to find new and better ways to meet the challenges of limited funding and personnel, while continuing to improve local infrastructure.

responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Yes, I support a small increase in the sale tax.  A sale tax increase would help to generate revenue to provide funding for critical county and municipalities services such as public safety, and other areas like code compliance and infrastructure improvements.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci:
Lack of Economic Development - Promote job creation by attracting new businesses and investment generating revenue to our city.
Public Safety - Improve our neighborhood quality and public safety by improving our code enforcement. 
Deteriorating Infrastructure - Create a safe, clean living environments for all residents.   
A Divided Community - Working together with all residents and soliciting their input is key. Everyone should be made to feel equally valued as citizens.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: I need to read up on this issue before providing a definitive answer!
responses.Can_the_problem_of_homelessness_and_panh: I would seek to devote resources to investigating ways in which we can stabilize people through shelter, moving them into permanent housing, and implementing assistance programs to keep them in their housing, therefore eliminating their need to panhandle. Also strengthen our commitment to organizations already meeting the needs of the homeless!
responses.Do_you_feel_like_its_possible_to_shape_a: I believe the promotion of economic growth to be a necessity while development a luxury which we may not always be able to afford or count practical at times. I believe that economic growth must be tailored to meet the needs of our City as a whole.  The City must invest and challenge and offer incentives to local businesses to invest in our economically depressed communities if we are serious about reducing crime and poverty!
responses.For_each_college_degree_you_have_list_th: Applied Technology Diploma- Emergency Medical Technician, Palm Beach State College.
responses.Is_poverty_a_problem_in_and_around_your_: I would change that by doing exactly what I am doing now, LEADING BY EXAMPLE! I've led protests against the violence in my community and I've started a mentoring initiative for fatherless young men among many other things. I believe that the solutions to the problems that poor communities like mine faces lies within the people themselves. We are the solutions to the problems we face as a community!
responses.List_municipal_committees_youve_been_app: The Mayor's Village Initiative, The African American Advisory Council, The Peace in the Streets Campaign.
responses.List_your_current_job_and_date_range_you: Children's Home Society- Youth Worker (2015-2016), Bow Down Ministries- Director of Operations (2013-2015).
responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: No because I believe that those who are on the lower income end of the socioeconomic scale would be the most adversely affected by any tax increase and I do not want to burden them any more than they already are.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: Although, lowering property taxes is a priority of mine, the more important issue is raising revenue.  This needs to be done in the Town of Lake Park not by raising taxes but by increasing the tax base through smart planning, better management of both our CRA and marina, and by adding property to the tax roles.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla:
Our commission is currently working on an improvement plan for the US 1 Corridor to revitalize the area and tie into the improvements made through the CRA in Riviera Beach.
There are two other areas that we expect growth to occur. One is the western region up to Congress Avenue that includes both commercial and light industrial zoning, and the other is our own CRA district around Park Avenue that is experiencing a arts and cultural revitalization.

responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: Yes, we are working hard to improve the services to our town, but this past term the commission has focused on bringing the town into financially healthy state.  it has been difficult at times and as a result we have not put enough into our roads.  More needs to be done to improve our finical picture.

responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: The towns biggest issue is the need to expand the tax based.  Through the growth plans discussed I will work to resolve that issue.  Additionally, the Lake Shore drainage presents a problem that must be addressed to make US 1 an attractive area to developers.  I've worked on several approaches to resolving that problem.

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: As the property values decreased during the recession, the tax rates increased to maintain income for the cities, however, now that the values have gone back up, the rates need to come back down.  The property tax increases are becoming a hardship for too many people.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Our city is fully developed and can't support additional growth without sacrificing common areas or the golf course land, which I'm opposed to.

responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci: The voice of the City clearly wants to maintain the present Quality of Life

responses.As_property_values_have_increased_for_th: With the increasing influx of visitors and tourists to South Florida we need to have adequate infrastructure to handle the escalation.
responses.Do_you_support_growth_in_your_city_Expla: Ocean Ridge is noted for its quiet safe lifestyle, with plenty of green space. We are a residential community, very near population capacity. Growth is really not an issue.The town's population has remained about the same for years. Our boundaries are defined by the ocean, the Intracoastal, an inlet, and a town to the south.

responses.Is_your_city_doing_enough_to_maintain_se: We are a small residential community. The current police department does an outstanding job. In the coming years, some of the roads in town will need attention. But the town officials, and in particular, the Town Manager, are aware of these needs. Schools do not apply to Ocean Ridge

responses.Palm_Beach_County_may_ask_voters_this_ye: Property taxes, used effectively, preclude the need for a sales tax.
responses.What_are_the_biggest_problems_in_your_ci:
As the South Florida coast continues to enjoy population growth, Ocean Ridge, with its limited resources and infrastructure, must plan for the future.  It is time for Ocean Ridge, with neighboring communities, to develop a five and ten year plan that lets us deal effectively with these significant challenges.
Beach erosion: Ocean Ridge's entire eastern boundary is the Atlantic Ocean. Preserving our coast is important to all Floridians.
